website_summaries.verdict: Fits Presta and Schrader valves. Telescopic handle has two pumping modes. Mounting bracket and puncture kit add to value.
pros: Popular for two pumping modes: extended for high volume or shorter for high pressure
Universal valve compatible with Presta and Schrader valves
Includes repair kit and bracket for mounting to bike
cons: Nearly impossible to reach 120 psi as claimed

customer_reviews.title: Super Sweet Little Pump!
customer_reviews.text: This pump has 2 stages of pumping (which I was unaware of when I bought it). For fast inflation, you unlock the collar on the pump and the pump extends much further; twice as far I believe. This allows much more air per pump. Once you get to a higher pressure, you lock the collar back down and then pump with shorter strokes. I've tested it on my bike before a ride and it works well. This is not a replacement for your full-size pump, but seems like it'll be great when needed on the road!
customer_reviews.author: James Eric Mushrush

customer_reviews.title: i thought it was going to be good based on the reviews
customer_reviews.text: it worked while I used it.. however, yesterday when I was out on a trail, i tried to pump up my flat and the pump broke. the lever you use to pump just completely fell out. i thought it was going to be good based on the reviews.. it worked well when I used it.. but after having it for less than 30 days.. it fell apart..
customer_reviews.author: david sosa

customer_reviews.title: Pump for Touring.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump for my touring bike, rather than rely on the cartridges on long trips. The pump mounts beside the pedal easily, plus looks tidy and attractive there. Haven't had to use it much so far, but it seems to work well, particularly in the "shorter stroke " mode, on my 27" tires at 70 PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Ian N

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: this is not a conclusive test, but on 2 bikes (1 schrager, 1 presta), 4 tires, this pump was unable to put air in any of my tires. i couldn't pump. no air went in. i'm talking it couldn't pump 40 - 50 lbs on the schrager tires, and 100 - 110 lbs on the presta tires. i lowered the pressure to try to add air. the pump couldn't pump any air... try another pump
customer_reviews.author: LegalTech

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED !!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help air up my kid's bikes and I was not; am not happy with this product at all. Barely opened it up and the dust cover snapped off immediately after opening the package. Then tried it on two bikes, would not work at all. Was under the impression that it was easy to use, NOT TRUE !. Tried to return it but now can't. Just very disappointed that Amazon would recommend this :(
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mckinnies

customer_reviews.title: Useless for Fat bikes, great for road bikes
customer_reviews.text: This pump is extremely LOW VOLUME, but it is HIGH PRESSURE. This means that trying to pump up a 25PSI 4" wide MTB tire is almost an exercise in futility, while it works just fine on a narrow 100PSI road tire. I own an MTB, so this emergency pump is little better than a paperweight, and a high volume (I.E., wide bore, long stroke) MTB pumps appear to be very hard to find. I have ordered this, but have not yet tested it:
customer_reviews.author: C. W. Sayre

customer_reviews.title: Good for MTB, not so much for road
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bike pump for nearly 2 years now and it definitely saved me from walking home a few times, both on mountain and road bikes. However, its 120 psi claim is COMPLETELY FALSE. I can only get a road tire up to around 50 psi before the pump starts leaking air out the seal. It's good enough to limp over to the nearest bike shop but that's about it. If you need a good quality mini-pump for road cycling, I would suggest you don't skimp on the cash and get yourself something much better. Good for MTB, not so good for road.
customer_reviews.author: C. Songer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for motorcycle/bicycle onboard toolkit.
customer_reviews.text: This little pump works as advertised. The included patch kit is functional when you have no other choice. I patched a small hole in my front tube on my KLR650. This was my first experience with this product and I was more than a little worried. If this hadn't worked, I was in for a long walk. The patch was small but large enough....The pump aired up my totally flat 3.00 x 21 tire to 40 lbs. with a total of 300 strokes. I know that sounds like a lot but keep in mind that IT DID WORK and even though I had to work for it, I had a a roadworthy repair under some difficult circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash, do not buy this pump. It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Buying this pump is one of the worst decisions I've ever made it in my entire life. I waited patiently for it to arrive, tried desperately to get it to add air to my bike tire, only to find that it was becoming more flat as I pain-stakingly tried to add more air with this tiny little hand pump. It's terrible. Absolutely terrible. Don't buy it. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: John Snow

customer_reviews.title: Just arrived and used to pump up my new bicycle
customer_reviews.text: I haven't ridden a bicycle in over 20 years, purchased a bicycle online and of course came to amazon to find the must haves. I read thru the reviews and this seem like a good buy. My new bicycle arrived and i used this to pump up the tires. I don't have a tire guage so I can't attest to the PSI, but this pump did push enough air into the tires to allow me to take it for a spin. Its quite possible my psi is low, but to have this thing with me in case of an emergency and I need air im quite satisfied it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: robby23rd

customer_reviews.title: Gets about 60 psi
customer_reviews.text: It's not as easy to use and you might like. I get about 35 psi from the faster fill setting and up to 60 psi with reasonable time and effort after locking it into high pressure mode. Some road tires may need 80 psi to seat the bead without massaging. Mine included. So keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S.

customer_reviews.title: Schrader Valve?
customer_reviews.text: Returned 2x looking for missing valve.(?) The pump is very lightweight & portable but doesn't seem durable. It would require a lot of time & effort to fill a tire at any pressure. The packaging displays Shrader & Presta valves. If the Shrader valve is the inside of the pump head that's not explained & seems like it could damage a valve.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mine does not pump air into a tire. In ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine does not pump air into a tire. In fact, the more I pump, the more air it *removes* from the tire I'll likely return it.
customer_reviews.author: 🐱 Cat Slack Attack 🚀

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I was completely unable to use this pump at all. I'd been carrying it around on my bike for months thinking that it was a backup option while riding around on a tire with a slow leak. I'm glad I finally decided to test it out at home rather than waiting until I really needed it. I pitched it into the trash shortly thereafter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: rubber ring inside the chuck gets chewed up
customer_reviews.text: The rubber ring inside the chuck gets chewed up on the valve stem and obstructs the valve. Sometimes, it takes a few tries to get it seated properly. Or I have to take a set of pliers and pull off slivers of rubber.Otherwise, it's like pumping into an already inflated tire and no air gets in. Once it is seated, then it works as expected. Still, that rubber ring inside needs to be reworked. Maybe the inner diameter is too small. Update: I received the replacement and this one seems to fit without the same issues. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: OCD_OBD

customer_reviews.title: Strength Required
customer_reviews.text: does not clamp on very tight when using this so called smart valve adapter... since it doesn't grip you need to use one arm to hold the pump on the valve tight... and then pumping takes a whole lot of effort to get to 50 PSI because this is a very small capacity barrel! good for a mountain bike but hard for a road bike incredibly hard to get to a high PSI ...ypu need to be a bodybuilder! Wind up using a 16 gram see Co2 powered air pump... Hopefully the patch is useful on my polaris diesel rear tireon my Polaris diesel rear tire...
customer_reviews.author: balu

customer_reviews.title: Good for emergencies, wouldn't use as a main pump though.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking I would use it as my main bike pump. That was silly. It takes a lot of time and effort to pump with this thing! Its great to keep on your bike, along with the included patch kit, for those times where you are biking far from home. Will work in a pinch to get you rolling again, but make sure you purchase a larger pump so you don't spend hours (not literally) and precious calories inflating your tires. Build of the pump is pretty cheap feeling, but it works for the intended purpose so whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Crusty Chris

customer_reviews.title: Missing patches
customer_reviews.text: I love the sleek and compact design of the pump. Makes easy for traveling. Finally opened the product and came to realize that the glueless patches were not in the package as stated 😳. I hope they take the time to inspect their packages and ensure all the contents are inside.
customer_reviews.author: chinedu ogueri

customer_reviews.title: Its better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: Not the worst emergency pump, but definitely not the best. the pump handle only seems to properly seal/push air during the bottom 1/3 of the stroke, the rest of it doesnt do much. it also requires a bit of fidgetting to get a proper seating on my air valves where it will actually inflate properly. after about 10 minutes of testing it out, i decided to stick to my regular air pump and keep this one for emergencies only
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great mini pump at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Small, but powerful, the "telescoping" feature to get a higher volume of air at lower pressures saves a lot of time. And in "short stroke" mode it can easily exceed 100 PSI, given enough time. It's a mini pump, don't go planning on using it as your main pump, but it is small enough to fit in a jersy pocket or mounted next to a water bottle. light, small will save you on the road if/when you get a puncture. I've used one of the patches, it gave out after several hours, great pump, sucky patches. Highly recommended as your "emergency" pump, at under $30, it's a steal.
customer_reviews.author: CLAY M GLAD

customer_reviews.title: Quick adaptation.
customer_reviews.text: I am not an experienced cyclist. It was the important to my wife that I prepare myself as well as possible for the things I could take care of on my own. I ordered the Vibrelli Mini because of the high reviews it was getting on Amazon and I (my wife included) could not be more pleased. There is a lot on you tube about this pump and it deserves all the positive support. It’s a great go to.
customer_reviews.author: krigdon

customer_reviews.title: Great pump, but beware the patches!
customer_reviews.text: Had a pretty crappy portable pump that was supposed to work with presta bike tire valves that I'm 99% certain was broken. This one is leagues better; because of the metal body it has a weighty feel (while still being very lightweight) that doesn't make it feel as incredibly cheap as my old one and the two levels of pumping for low and high pressure is great. But beware the glueless patches, I'm not sure if maybe the ones I got were old or defective but most that I used either wouldn't stick or flaked off a little later. Might've just been me but either way be aware of that and buy extra patches.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: small and something to take with you on a long ride - this will be perfect. If you want to pump up a tire ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works. It's not exactly an efficient pump. You'll work hard for it to pump up a tire. I suspect this is mostly due to its size. Not a very long rod and the diameter is very small as well. Every pump has its trade offs. If you're going for light, small and something to take with you on a long ride - this will be perfect. If you want to pump up a tire fast and you're storing it in your garage, you'll probably want something bigger and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: TheSpecialist

customer_reviews.title: Good, but hard to reach full pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to complain, for a $20 pump. Lightweight, compact, and well designed, overall. I like that it came with a carrier and patch kit. This thing will definitely get you out of a pinch but I’ve pumped up several flat tubes now and couldn’t get them up to full pressure even with considerable effort. Would be nice if the handle folded out perpendicular to the piston, as it would make it easier to grip. Worked well for both Schrader and Presta valves. Glad to have it with me in case of a flat; it’ll get you going til you can get to a gas station at minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Milano

customer_reviews.title: MUST CARRY FOR OFF-ROAD BIKERS
customer_reviews.text: Best Price around, No Cons yet PROS Very compact Includes both inflator valves and tire patches all in a small aluminum box Pump itself is very compact but packs a punch Included mounts to attach directly to your bike both vertical or horizontal by your water bottle holder
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Tiny little Air Pump works great and stores in a tiny pouch
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome tiny pump that stores in a small utility bag mounted on a bike. I barrowed a bike from a buddy and needed to put some air in the tire before the first ride, and maybe during the ride so I wanted something portable. This pump expands to allow more are per pump and inflated the tire pretty quickly and it locks onto the stem so you don't have to hold everything perfectly. Also so small that it fit in a little cell phone bag my buddies bike had on the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C

customer_reviews.title: Portable pump
customer_reviews.text: This is a great portable pump to have around for quick bike trips that may require air. Nice to have aroind instead of taking ghe bike to a gas station or something to fill up you bike tires or basketballs. I haven't tried it on a car even though it would work but you'll probably have to use it for a period of time if your tires are really flat. I liked that no attachments were needed for the tire. You just slip it on and lock it and pump the air into it. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Asia

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I attached the pump to my road bike for those times when I have a flat on the road. Last week, I did. The pump worked well and carried a small surprise - it is a 2-stage to pump. There is a lock ring that can be twisted to give the pump a lot more air each pump, that was a nice feature to have. It pumped my new presta tube up and I was able to complete my ride with decent pressure.
customer_reviews.author: James B Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Barely Passable
customer_reviews.text: This pump is barely functional for filling road bike tires with a presta valve. The issue lies with the seal that the pump makes with the presta valve itself. Roughly around 65-70psi (measured by my floor pump) any movement of the interface of the pump with the valve will cause air to leak out. I’ve also had the pump pop off of the valve. 65-70psi is passable to get home on my bike so the pump is still being used but I will replace this pump with something better. Build quality was 4/5 Design 2.5/5 Usability 2/5 I wouldn’t recommend this as a road bike pump for presta valves.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Hall

customer_reviews.title: handy and super small
customer_reviews.text: picked this up for my new bike. I had a low tire on a ride and figured it would be helpful to own something like this. I keep it in my saddlebag with a spare inner tube incase I get a flat while I'm out riding. nice quality and looks like this company stands behind their product which is important. comes with mounting hardware to mount to your fame if you choose. I tried this but my leg kept hitting it so I just keep it in my saddlebag.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Good pump, bad patches
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after buying this pump and patch kit I was out on a ride and got a flat (small piece of glass). The patches were easy to use, the pump worked perfectly, and within minutes I was on my way. Then the next day I went out and saw that my tire was again flat - the patch had come off. I figured I must not have sanded the area sufficiently so I took that patch off and applied a new one. And the same thing happened again now. While the pump works well and the mount attaches nicely to my bike, I am pretty disappointed with the performance of these patches.
customer_reviews.author: R. Piatek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product backed by amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: This bike pump is pretty awesome. You can use it in both presta and shrader valves and all you have to do is insert it no adapter necessary. Their customer service is outstanding if you do have any problem you can reach out to them and they’ll get back to you within 24 hours
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for MTB tires.
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless pump. I bought this to carry on my MTB in case I ever got a flat on the road. Your arm will fall off before you even get to 5 psi. Useless if you get a flat on the road. I ended up walking my bike home. The patches that come with this pump are a step below scotch tape. The only thing I could see this pump being useful for is pumping up balloons and scratching your back.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: it does a really good job airing up a low tire
customer_reviews.text: I had to use this on my last ride and I was very worried about its quality and was pleasantly surprised. for a little unit, it does a really good job airing up a low tire, it would take a lot of work to inflate a new tube but just adding air its great. The only reason I rated at 4 stars is the clip it comes with could be a little more adaptable but it held it well during my 25-mile ride on a bike path. The pump packs a good punch in airing up.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Bess

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I was actually able to fit into my bike saddle, just barely. All these manufacturers provide frame mounts made of plastic. My last one broke and on the trip back I noticed I lost my last pump. I did more research on what pump to buy this time and this was one of the two. I opted for this one and have used a couple times. Is seems effective all in all, and I like that it is smaller than the last one I lost.
customer_reviews.author: EMN

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you have Henry Cavill’s upper body strength.
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have amazing upper body strength, don’t waste your time with this pump, get a floor pump you push down on or step on. I thought this would be great to have in case I needed to pump a tire while out, but I couldn’t even get it to pump enough air into the tire to begin with. I couldn’t even get a third of the required psi for my tire that was almost completely flat and ended up having to buy a completely different pump altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good pump but terrible patches
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pump, its portable and easy to use. Not needing to change adapters is fantastic! However, the included patches are horrible. Tried using three to patch a pinhole puncture in my inner tube before giving up and walking to my local bike store to buy some higher quality patches. So really you're just paying for a pump and some useless stickers. The pump in of itself should make it worth while
customer_reviews.author: Ed Alcazar

customer_reviews.title: Vibrelli Pump: 1 Pothole: 0
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy to have this little pump when I tangled with one of the infamous SF potholes and lost, resulting in a 100% flat tire and a bent presta valve. Got my bike up on a fence to help take pressure off the tire and in under 5 minutes had plenty of pressure to get me home. The locking mechanism can be a little finicky and sometimes takes me a try or two to get the seal right. But overall this pump is solid, efficient and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: SFO85

customer_reviews.title: 5 star portable pump!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is awesome! Compact and lightweight! I didnt think it would be adequate but it does a great job putting air in either presto or schrader valve. It came with a tire patch kit as well and I ended up using it because I didn't have access to a spare tube. I didn’t think the patch kit would hold up but that adhesive patch held on and I was able to ride the trail and take myself home no problem. 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Weezy

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike Pump
customer_reviews.text: the pump is really small and light. They come with the holder than can be installed right on your bike in a specific location. It takes a lot of work to pump your tires compare to the bigger one, bc it is used as a portable pump. the only part is that there isn’t any lock for the pump, so when you put them on the bike, the pump keeps slide down by itself. overall, a really great bike bump!
customer_reviews.author: Nanabell

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike pump
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little bike pump. The quick clamp attach/release works perfectly, no slipping, no leaking. The 2-level volume pumping capability is a really nice feature, with a long stroke for rapid filling to lower pressures and easy switch over to short stroke pumping at the higher pressures to top off your tire. Nice mounting bracket and easy but secure clip in place. The only improvement to this would be the integration of an air pressure gauge. (See my review of their new bike pump with integrated air pressure gauge!)
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great air pump.
customer_reviews.text: The day I received the pump I was already using it. It is a small pump and easy to put into my pocket and it worked very well. I was very impressed with the pump, and it has a strap to use to hoist it on your bike if you don't have any screws to mount the bracket on. I found it easy to use and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nat From New York

customer_reviews.title: I wasn’t expecting this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was truly pleasantly surprised 😯 on how small and useful this device really is. Once you lock it in place it works great and inflates super fast. ( check directions on how to properly lock it in place on your tire ) This was a great purchase and I was once agin excited about riding my mountain bike 🚲 will purchase again. ☺️ Be well everyone
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: So so as a bike pump.
customer_reviews.text: This is an okay pump, it will work great for airing up footballs, basketballs, and soccer balls. I bought it to keep on my bike Incase I have a flat or need to add air while out riding, this it doesn’t do as well. If you get a flat, it will work, but it will take a long, long time to air up you tire. Once you get to an certain pressure, it gets almost impossible to use. The patches are useless too, just throw them out and buy some higher quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, good ideas, not implemented well
customer_reviews.text: 1 star for the combination of shrader, and presta. 1 star for variable filling (high and low) -2 stars for the terrible bike attahement ( -1 fell off all the time, -1 to the extent where that’s where I lost it) -1 for the floppy filling technique (when filling you have to hold it in a strange way to keep it from moving too much in either direction, otherwise it will literally bend your valve, and break it.... -1 another bonus star for the fact that I broke two tubes filling by barely moving the pump too much.
customer_reviews.author: gotmoosefur

customer_reviews.title: Bent my new presta valve on tire in seconds - bad mount
customer_reviews.text: I used this pump as per instructions on my new trek bike which has Presta style valves. I bent the valve after properly locking the pump in place. I also went to mount the unit, it only goes to the side opposite the chain due to the way the handle doesn't lock completely in place. it still mounts ok, but when will I use it, cost me a brand new tube!
customer_reviews.author: MacMaven234

customer_reviews.title: Small but Fierce!
customer_reviews.text: The fact that this little pump extends to make life easier is perfection! We used one not too long ago that didn't extend and it took two men taking turns to get the tire aired up. I'm a woman and this saved me on the road the other day. One of the little rubber pieces on the side is lifting, but oh well, it does what it's supposed to and takes up little to no space.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: The pump seems fine the patches are a bust.
customer_reviews.text: I was on the far side of my ride when my back tire on my road bike when flat. No worries, I pulled out my patch kit, sanded the tube, peeled and placed the patch.... Pressed hard.... the patch fell like a leaf. Maybe it was the Texas heat but there was absolutely no adhesion to the tube. I tried with a few other patches in the kit... no luck. I took out my spare tube and all worked out well. If you buy this pump, throw out the patches.
customer_reviews.author: Carlon

customer_reviews.title: A Smart Mini-Pump and a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little pump. I really like the features it has which set it apart from other mini-pumps. The connector that works with both Schrader and Presta valves without needing an adapter is great. Also, the high volume low pressure/low volume high pressure telescoping action is a very smart feature. This makes it faster to pump up your mountain bike tires and get to those high road bike tire pressures without needing a second pump. It's compact and lightweight making it easy to carry on the trail for emergencies. I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for a quality mini-pump.
customer_reviews.author: Don DraperTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here, its a mini portable pump, great for traveling. Every biker should probably have one of these its come in handy quite a few times! The added patch kit is a nice bonus to have with you for those just in case moments. I also like to play some pick up games and theres nothing worse like getting to a park and finding the ball doesn't have the right bounce, this thing fits right in your backpack or whatever and comes with the pin too so its win win. I probably wouldn't have bought it just for that purpose but since I ride bikes and shoot hoop its like a double bonus
customer_reviews.author: JahRebel RastafariTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: For emergency use only - do NOT expect to get up to the advertised 120 PSI
customer_reviews.text: It works reasonably for low PSI usage but it starts to become nearly impossible to get air into a tier once you get passed the 40-50 PSI range. Maybe someone much stronger can do it but an average-ish person like myself started to struggle half way there. I will still carry it around and use it even though I'm a little disappointed by the exaggeration.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pump.
customer_reviews.text: Solid pump that does it's job. I was impressed at how well it stayed on the bike. I intentionally put in through the ringer to see if it would pop off, but at the end of the way, it stayed right where it was. Also a nice little bonus that it comes with a needle inflated, so I was able to air up a flat basketball I had sitting in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Gossler

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Just didn’t fit my rims.
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality pump, however I will need to return it, as the clamp is too long for my rims and will not seat itself to pump air. I instead need a pump with a hose (I think I saw one made by Vibrelli and if so, I’m ordering it today). Otherwise, no issues with this pump. Regular spoke rims and I would have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: MPK

customer_reviews.title: Presta x Schrader
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if I used it wrong, but I found no manuals to check if I did it right. I first pumped a Schrader valve, it was hard to fit (interference with the inner rubber) and then very hard to remove - even damaging the rubber. I wonder if I damaged the pump itself. Then I used in a Presta valve, it worked ok without problems. I dont know now if I have to return this pump (for the Shrader rubber disintegrated at the first use?), maybe someone from Vibrelli can tell? Thanks! Nilson.
customer_reviews.author: fuzita

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: So I was super excited, this clips right on my bike so if I need it while out on a ride it's right there, awesome right? Well not really since we found out the hard way it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Longino

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Graco jogging stroller
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit between spokes of the front tire of my Graco jogging stroller and barely fits on the back two. I have to be at an odd angle to pump them up, and that was the whole reason I bought this pump. It doesn't come with clear instructions about the adaptable valve and is hard to keep snug on the tire. If you're not using it for a stroller, it may be better. It's pretty light. Easy to stow in a bag or basket for your ride. Overall, an okay product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Hit a pothole on my morning ride - result flat tire. Thanks to this pump I was able to change the inner tube and fill it to proper level. Didn't have to walk home. Great Pump.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cortlandt

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to place on the bike
customer_reviews.text: Decent pump for the money. Compact and easy to place on the bike. I happened to have available screw mounts so it went on perfectly. I haven't used it yet, thankfully, but having it gives me peace of mind. I recommend it provided you have mounting screws on your bike, otherwise, I'm unsure how to install them, maybe with rubber bands that lock on or velcro strap it in such a way that it will slide on the frame of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Tonester64

customer_reviews.title: Budget pump to get you to high pressures
customer_reviews.text: Did a test run with the pump to a satisfactory degree. Much better than my existing pump which wouldn't get past 40psi. The high volume feature is awesome for the initial inflate. Once you get to the high pressure range (>40psi), it does get considerably more difficult, though the dual settings of this pump makes it possible (though another 150-200 pumps away from 90psi on 700x28c). Only major quip for a pump like this (since it is expected to take a while to pump) is the holder design is rather unique, can really only be mounted on the bottom holder, and the handle doesn't lock in, making this holder your only option.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Durand

customer_reviews.title: Ummm. No.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this bugger it kinda pumped up the tire. I finished with a regular compressor. The second time I used it it let the air out of the tire fine. It's putting air in that was the problem. I threw it into an appropriate corn field and walked the bike home. Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: Dommie

customer_reviews.title: This pump really works!
customer_reviews.text: This pump really works! I have tried a couple and came to the conclusion that a double chamber pump is much more likely to allow for sufficiently fast pumping. The Vibrelli mini pump may not be the lightest - it isn't heavy either - but it does a great job pumping fast and requires little effort. The pump is short and fits easily into my jersey pocket.
customer_reviews.author: astro

customer_reviews.title: Used it for an Electric Scooter
customer_reviews.text: Electric scooter wheels are notorious to remove. The front tire to one of our e-scooters has a hole. This kit includes accessories to plug the hole. The one thing we noticed is you would need a valve extender if your e-scooter cable is facing out of the tire. It took less than 10 pumps to inflate the tire. It will happen more often so we’re glad it can be attached to the scooter itself and portable.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice pump, but has one issue
customer_reviews.text: I got this a while back since I got a flat miles away from home and needed to walk my bike back and didn't feel like doing that again. Fast forward to recently, I had a tire that lost quite a bit of air pressure before my return trip home, and luckily I had this on me, or so I thought. Turns out that this pump doesn't fit Schrader valves particularly well. Presta valves though, it works fantastically for (and those are what I'm using now since I would have to buy a new tube anyhow).
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with recent purchase. It's very well made and compact. I was at first missing a small part to attach it to my bike. The company stepped up without hesitation quickly sent out a whole new package, that I received today. They didn't have to do that as I just needed a small part. It might be a supply chain issue. I'm not sure but I will definitely keep this company in mind for any future needs. Very easy to use and brought back to life some super old inner tubes and tires. Again, very happy and thankful for a company to go out of its way to take care of its customers during these hectic times.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: The Vibrelli pump worked exactly as indicated by the instructions. It cost a bit more than other portable pumps I've used, but is of higher quality and workmanship, and therefore of more value for the dollar. The dual-stroke option is a welcome feature, as are the included tube patches. I recommend this pump unreservedly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact kit, fits nicely on bike
customer_reviews.text: This compact kit fits nicely on your bike without getting too much int he way. I like the no valve changing ability of this kit. I have not yet had to use this for a repair but I did use it to pump some air back into a tire that lost it over time. It worked well, just keep in mind this is a SMALL pump so its going to take some time before you fill up the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Received order one day ahead of schedule. Was excited to be able to use it for flat bike tire. Unfortunately two critical pieces were missing, the schrader and the presta. Without these two pieces the bike pump cannot be used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect air pump for a racing bike
customer_reviews.text: This air pump is part of my bike now. The ease of attaching this pump to the bike frame made it sturdy, handy, and a permanent fixture to my bike. I had a lot of problems with the bigger air pumps. This small light weight air pump is a must to have on your bike if you are a serious rider.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great for portability
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pump to take on a ride but shouldn't be your primary pump. If you are filling a new tube or flat you will get your daily workout.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas J. Bragg Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Great when you're in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and portable, yes. Fairly easy to use.. It's a small workout to get your tire up to biking pressure once you get a flat but it works. Had issues and first had low rating, but issues were my own, not product. Will happily carry on my bike for any flats i get in the future.
customer_reviews.author: FrisoReinke

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight, secures well to bike
customer_reviews.text: Innovative design and lightweight. Has good secure mount for bike.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of crap! Can’t get any high pressure air in the bike tire. Also bent the valve stem trying to get air in the tire. Don’t waste your time or money. Sending this back for a refund. I had to give it one star to accept the review, but in reality I give it Zero stars...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pump with a bonus patch kit
customer_reviews.text: Pump is very well made and includes a bracket that can either be attached via a Velcro buckle or better yet attach along with a water bottle holder and pump sits flush alongside the bottle when inserted into the holder. Many have commented on not knowing how to carry the small tin that includes the patch kit. I removed my rear reflector, purchased an led light from Blitzu, and then superglued the tin to the bracket that held the original standard reflector from the store. Then just reattached that bracket and voila, the patch kit is secured under the seat above my new led light. Works perfect and can still open tin when needed and very astetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: XP1083

customer_reviews.title: Portable but hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Don’t expect to pump up your road bike or other high PSI tire with this thing. The reviews/description might make you think it’s possible and while it may be rated to 120 PSI it is extremely difficult to inflate past 50 psi even with the high pressure setting on the pump. It took me well over 30 minutes to get my tires to 80 PSI (that’s a LOT of pumps). Good for topping up on the road maybe but this will not replace a proper floor pump.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Small yet capable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I grabbed this for my Stumpjumper. when I first got it, I couldn't believe how small it actually was. Right out of the box, I was happy with the quality and used it right away. I was immediately impressed. By far the easiest, and quickest bike pump you can have on hand. If your looking for a small but capable pump for home or on the go, you won't go wrong with this pump.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Torres

customer_reviews.title: A good pump
customer_reviews.text: I imagine this is true for any mini-pump, but it's laborious to use this pump to inflate a bike tire. The ability to switch between high-volume and high-pressure modes is very helpful, but it still takes more effort than I'd expected. That aside, it seems to be a well-built pump. It's small, light, and easy to carry in your pack, if you don't mount it on your frame.
customer_reviews.author: Walter T. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Close, but no Cigar...
customer_reviews.text: Skip this product. It does not work. Maybe I got a dud, but either way, I am not happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGuy

customer_reviews.title: Not a good pump
customer_reviews.text: The pump seems fine but it cannot pump 120 psi on a road bike .. it cannot seal good especially on presto valve .. its fine if you want to out a little air in the tire till you get a real pump
customer_reviews.author: mahir cenanovic

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is okay to have on the road. It will inflate a tire here or there, but it wont pump the tires up to the required pressure. It will get you by while on the road, but make no mistake it will not replace your floor mounted bike pump. Also, if you have a Presta Valve be careful. The torque you put on it may bend the valve.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works for both valves, can take a good amount of pumping, but it's a travel pump
customer_reviews.text: Can confirm it works without doing anything for both schraeder and presta valves. Very easy, rather efficient. It's not a full pump, but it doesn't claim to be. For me, though, it mostly replaces one. Does take a bit to pump up to a moderate pressure though. The cover flap sucks, and I wish the pump handle locked in place for travel (it slides out very easily), but overall, it's small, light, and pumps the tire up to where I need. Haven't used the puncture kit yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel pump.
customer_reviews.text: The no-adapter Shrader/presta valve head is what makes this so awesome. Works as advertised, while I wouldn't want to use this for bulk fills, it's perfect for a quick top off or emergency use. Packs super small. Wonderful pump.
customer_reviews.author: mdisher

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be very well made. It's heavy and ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very well made. It's heavy and works smoothly. I'm not sure how it does it, but there is no leakage when attaching or removing from the stem (Schrader, not sure about Presta). This is not a ding on the pump itself, just a reminder that this is a mini (maybe micro would be better) pump. Even in the High Volume mode it will take you quite a while to fill a 2" tire from fully flat...
customer_reviews.author: D. Waldmann

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Sure it’s portable. Tried it a couple of times to repump our bike tires before a ride, the hole was too wide to completely cover and fully allow air through the valve. We kept pumping and air just kept slipping out and you could hear it. Sadly can’t use it for much.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Portable airpump
customer_reviews.text: I would say it wasn't as efficient as I thought it would be, it's true that it has a mechanism that allows you to put more air at once but it's still not enough. Another thing is that when you're trying to pump air into the tire, it could be hard to pump the air by yourself since it requires some strength to pump air, and the way it is designed doesn't let you use your strength easily. It would help if there's some sort of extender between the air pump and the connector to the tire, unfortunately, that's not included in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Fifi Wu

customer_reviews.title: Love this pump!
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by a friend and it was sooooo worth it. I would love to say I hadn't had to use it in the two months I've owned it, but it's worked great both times I flatted. It fits in my back pouches or my saddlebag, barely. I'm super glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Compact and useful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this items for my brother, from what he has told me that the product is simple to use and better than the old fashion pumps. he's happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Radwani

customer_reviews.title: Out of the way but handy when needed
customer_reviews.text: I ride a Recumbent trike... Every once in a while a flat occurs... So having this mounted under a water bottle really makes sense... So far it is an insurance policy that has not been needed... Very well made.... I am sure it will last for years!
customer_reviews.author: larryzplace

customer_reviews.title: Like the product
customer_reviews.text: I received the Vibrelli bike pump very quickly. It seem good product, very solid and nice looking. I have not got a chance to used it yet I tried on my Trek bike valve and seems to work fine. I like the fact you don't need any adapter for different type of valve. Will be updating my review once I get to use the pump. Hopefully wont be because I got a flat !!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for slipping into my backpack
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a decent pump to have in my pack when mountain biking. I like the size and weight of this one. For quick hits, the short stroke is fine, but where this pump really shines is when fully extended. So much less work than lots of little pumps.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good pump but missing strap
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this product 5 stars; however, I did not receive the velcro strap. I did not think it was such a big deal. However, the first time my son rode his bike, the pump fell out of the bracket and hit the pavement! Pump still works but now we have to use a bungee cord to secure. Updated 8/17/19: I contacted the seller and Vibrelli did not respond to the email but a whole new pump package arrived in the mail! - updated review to 5 stars. I can't really use the second pump on a bike but we will keep it in the garage as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: TOO compact to do much
customer_reviews.text: This thing is way too small. My fault, what did i expect, but think about it -- the air chamber is so incredibly tiny that to get any volume or pressure it takes forever. Not worth it. Get a CO2 cartridge to carry, or a bigger frame pump. Too small to get enough volume of air with each pump.
customer_reviews.author: Krykie

customer_reviews.title: Pump is good but patch stickers are horrible
customer_reviews.text: The pymp itself is pretty good but the patching stickers are horrible. I tried to fix a flat tire by patching the hole on a tube and the sticker doesn't stay bonded it peels off. Already gone through three of them with no goid result. I don't think this is good patch kit other than the pump.... you will need a proper patch kit for fixing flat tires... so I give this two stars.
customer_reviews.author: cheez

customer_reviews.title: It’s not an air pump
customer_reviews.text: What a great air pump. I can hang it on the wall and never use it. Beware or take advantage. This is not an air pump as dit is described but a bike wall mount. I scanned the bar code with the amazon take a pic search and the air pump came up so there must something wrong on Amazon’s end.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin H Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: Great little pump
customer_reviews.text: Little pump big value. Sturdy and works well. Hung volume low pressure and high pressure low volume. Compact and light but doesn’t feel or act dainty.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio guy

customer_reviews.title: great pump.  A lot of airflow.
customer_reviews.text: I little on the heavy side but a very nice pump. I would give it 5 stars if it would lock into the closed position but it doesn't. I haven't tested it out and I'm not going to but it feels like if the handle were pointing down the vibration of riding cross or mtb would allow it to extend on it's own so I'm forced to mount it with the head pointing down so the handle doesn't extend. Again.. It's an assumption but who needs the headache if I'm right????
customer_reviews.author: John Tye

customer_reviews.title: Poor mounting system
customer_reviews.text: The pump itself is fine and compact, but the offset mounting system is terrible: much more in the way than the normal inline with the frame arrangement. The complete lack of mounting instructions suggests that they know this and want to obscure it. If it had not fit into my under-saddle pouch, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: RScott

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I put this rack on our mountain bikes, it was an easy install and I loaded it up with bags and gear immediately, took them on vacation. The bike was loaded in and out of trailers, on and off of a ferry and dropped on the ground every time we stopped. ( i need to buy kickstands) Even with fully loaded saddle bags and a cooler strapped to the top, the rack never budged.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Nanko

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: It is small and I could not make it work. I wish it was working. My return window passed and now I have it just in my garage for nothing :( I recommend getting something more robust and better.
customer_reviews.author: Henga

customer_reviews.title: Arrived without the patch kit.
customer_reviews.text: Shipment arrived without patch kit, which is one of the reasons I purchased the combo kit. The container was in the package bit no kit in the container. The pump does ok, as far as daily top off of air. Luckily I have not had to use it for a flat.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This pump was a little thick for me. There are times my leg bumps it when it's mounted to my frame. It's heavy for what it is as well. It does work and the expanding chamber is a nice touch of you need to get high pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Bradb

product_meta.title: Vibrelli Mini Bike Pump & Glueless Puncture Repair Kit - Fits Presta & Schrader - 120 PSI - No Valve Changing Needed.
feature_bullets: NO VALVE CHANGING OR ADAPTERS NEEDED: Automatically locks onto both Presta and Schrader tire valves
120 PSI EXTENDABLE TELESCOPE: Easily switch from high volume to high pressure
"SUPER FIT" CLEVER VALVE: No leaks, firmly grips both Schrader and Presta valves automatically
MOUNTING BRACKET: Attaches the tire pump to your bike, added velcro strap holds the pump firmly in place
INCLUDED: Glue-less puncture kit, be prepared for a flat tire anywhere

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
